caption.p: Studies based on machine learning for PD biomarker identification.

tr.td: 8 genes: VDR, HIP2, CLTB, FPRL2, CA12, CEACAM4, ACRV1, and UTX
38 de novo PDs, 24 early stage PDs (within 1st-year medication), 30 advanced PDs, 29 ADs and 64 HCs
5 genes: HIP2, ALDH1A1, PSMC4, HSPA8 and EGLN1
51 PDs, 34 APD (17 MSA and 17 PSP), 39 HCs
13 genes: C5ORF4, WLS, MACF1, PRG3, EFTUD2, PKM2, SLC14A1-S, SLC14A1-L, MPP1, COPZ1, ZNF160, MAP4K1 and ZNF134
Gene expression data from blood samples

7 out of 13 genes in previous study
56 : C5ORF4, COPZ1, MACF1, WLS, PRG3, ZNF160 and EFTUD2
6 genes: LRPPRC, BCL2, SRSF8, HSPA8, UBE2K, EGLN1
PLS-DA and LDA (a Bayesian classification method)
205 PDs, 233 HCs and 48 other neurodegenerative diseases
A gene signature of 87 gene (64 upregulated and 23 downregulated genes between PD and HC)

table-wrap-foot.p: AD Alzheimer’s disease, APD Atypical parkinsonian disorders, CPLS canonical partial least squares, HC Healthy control, KNN K-nearest neighbor classification, LDA linear discriminant regression (a Bayesian classification method), MSA multiple system atrophy, PD Parkinson’s disease, PSP progressive supra-nuclear palsy, qPCR quantitative polymerase chain reaction, SN substantia nigra, SVM support vector machine.
